intro: Coleus schoensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often forming a compact rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, white, and red, making it a popular ornamental plant. Coleus schoensis thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
